 A useful inference for substituting definitions into an equality. (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.)  (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.)
statement:
eqeq12i.1 $e |- A = B $.
eqeq12i.2 $e |- C = D $.
eqeq12i $p |- ( A = C <-> B = D ) $.
